Key Symptoms: Abdominal pain, bloating, gas, diarrhea, and/or constipation
Nutritional Considerations: Identifying and avoiding trigger foods, managing fiber intake, potentially a low-FODMAP diet
Foods to Emphasize: Easily digestible foods, soluble fiber (oats, psyllium), lean proteins, probiotics (if tolerated)
Foods to Limit/Avoid:
High-FODMAP
foods (certain fruits, vegetables, grains, dairy), processed foods, caffeine, alcohol, artificial sweeteners, fatty foods (individual triggers vary)

Key Symptoms: Abdominal pain, diarrhea, weight loss, fatigue, malnutrition
Nutritional Considerations: Managing inflammation, replacing nutrient losses, maintaining adequate calorie and protein intake
Foods to Emphasize: Easily digestible foods, low-fiber options during flares, small frequent meals, liquid nutritional supplements (if needed)
Foods to Limit/Avoid:
High-fiber foods, fatty/fried foods, dairy (if intolerant), spicy foods, caffeine, alcohol (individual tolerances
vary)

Key Symptoms: Diarrhea (often with blood), abdominal pain, urgency, weight loss, anemia
Nutritional Considerations: Managing inflammation, replacing nutrient losses, maintaining adequate calorie and protein intake
Foods to Emphasize: Easily digestible foods, low-fiber options during flares, small frequent meals, liquid nutritional supplements (if needed)
Foods to Limit/Avoid:
High-fiber foods, fatty/fried foods, dairy (if intolerant), spicy foods, caffeine, alcohol (individual tolerances
vary)

Key Symptoms: Fatigue, swelling, changes in urination, nausea, loss of appetite
Nutritional Considerations: Managing electrolyte balance (sodium, potassium, phosphorus),limiting protein (in later stages), fluid management
Foods to Emphasize: Low-sodium foods, controlled potassium and phosphorus foods,adequate calorie intake with healthy fats and limited protein (as advised)
Foods to Limit/Avoid:
High-sodium foods,
high-potassium foods (e.g., bananas,
tomatoes), high-phosphoru s foods (e.g., dairy, beans, nuts), excessive protein (especially in later stages), processed
foods

Key Symptoms: Shortness of breath, fatigue, swelling in legs and ankles, rapid heartbeat
Nutritional Considerations: Sodium restriction, fluid management, adequate potassium intake (if not on certain medications)
Foods to Emphasize:
Fresh fruits and vegetables (with attention to potassium levels), whole grains, lean proteins,
low-sodium
options
Foods to Limit/Avoid: High-sodium foods, excessive fluids, saturated and trans fats, processed foods

Key Symptoms: Sudden, severe pain in joints (often the big toe), redness, swelling
Nutritional Considerations: Managing uric acid levels through diet, maintaining a healthy weight, limiting alcohol
Foods to Emphasize:
Cherries, low-fat dairy, complex
carbohydrates, plenty of water
Foods to Limit/Avoid:
High-purine foods (red meat, organ meats, some seafood), fructose-sweet ened drinks, excessive alcohol (especially
beer)

Key Symptoms: Fatigue, weight gain, feeling cold, dry skin, hair loss
Nutritional Considerations: Ensuring adequate iodine intake, addressing potential nutrient deficiencies (e.g., selenium, iron)
Foods to Emphasize: Iodized salt, seafood, eggs, foods rich in selenium (Brazil nuts, tuna, sardines), foods rich in iron (red meat, spinach, lentils)
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Excessive intake of goitrogenic foods (cruciferous vegetables like broccoli, cabbage, kale) in raw form, highly processed foods

Key Symptoms: Weight loss, rapid heartbeat, anxiety, sweating, increased appetite
Nutritional Considerations:
Managing iodine intake, avoiding excessive iodine,  ensuring adequate calorie intake to compensate for increased
metabolism
Foods to Emphasize: Foods low in iodine, adequate calories,nutrients to support increased metabolism
Foods to Limit/Avoid: High-iodine foods (iodized salt, seaweed, seafood),excessive caffeine

Key Symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, reduced range of motion
Nutritional Considerations: Maintaining a healthy weight, anti-inflammato ry diet may be beneficial
Foods to Emphasize: Fruits, vegetables, whole grains, healthy fats (omega-3s  from fatty fish, flaxseeds), lean proteins
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Processed foods, excessive saturated and trans fats, sugary drinks (to help maintain healthy weight)

Nutritional Considerations: Anti-inflammato ry diet may help manage symptoms
Foods to Emphasize: Fruits, vegetables, whole grains, healthy fats (omega-3s  from fatty fish, flaxseeds), lean proteins, foods rich in antioxidants
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Processed foods, excessive saturated and trans fats, sugary drinks (potential inflammatory effects - individual triggers may vary)

Nutritional Considerations: Focus on blood sugar control, weight management, adequate fiber intake
Foods to Emphasize:
Whole grains,
non-starchy vegetables, lean proteins, healthy fats
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Sugary drinks, processed foods, refined carbohydrates, excessive saturated and trans fats

Nutritional Considerations: Sodium restriction, potassium intake, maintaining a healthy weight
Foods to Emphasize: Fruits, vegetables, low-sodium options, lean proteins, whole grains, low-fat dairy
Foods to Limit/Avoid: High-sodium foods, processed foods, foods high in saturated and trans fats, excessive alcohol

Nutritional Considerations: Increase iron intake, ensure adequate vitamin B12 and folate
Foods to Emphasize: Red meat, leafy green vegetables, beans, lentils, fortified cereals
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Foods that may inhibit iron absorption (e.g., excessive tea, coffee, calcium-rich foods consumed with iron-rich meals)

Nutritional Considerations:
Adequate calcium and vitamin D intake,
weight-bearing exercise
Foods to Emphasize: Dairy products, leafy green vegetables, fortified foods, fatty fish (for vitamin D)
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Excessive alcohol, caffeine, and sodium, which can interfere with calcium absorption

Nutritional Considerations:
Strict
gluten-free diet
Foods to Emphasize:
Naturally
gluten-free grains (rice, quinoa, corn), fruits, vegetables, gluten-free labeled
products.
Foods to Limit/Avoid:
Wheat,
barley, rye, and products containing gluten

Nutritional Considerations: Strict blood sugar control through insulin and diet, carbohydrate counting, balanced meals
Foods to Emphasize:
Non-starchy vegetables, lean proteins, healthy fats, whole grains (in controlled portions), fruits (in controlled
portions)
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Sugary drinks, processed foods, refined carbohydrates, excessive portions of carbohydrates

Nutritional Considerations: Blood sugar control through diet, exercise, and medication (if needed), weight management, balanced meals
Foods to Emphasize: Non-starchy vegetables, lean proteins, healthy fats, whole grains, fruits (in moderation)
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Sugary drinks, processed foods, refined carbohydrates, excessive saturated and trans fats

Nutritional Considerations: Maintaining a healthy weight, anti-inflammato ry diet may be supportive (not a primary treatment)
Foods to Emphasize:
Fruits and vegetables (rich in antioxidants), omega-3 fatty acids (from fatty fish), foods rich in
vitamin D
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Processed foods, sulfites (in some foods and drinks), potential food allergens (individual triggers vary)

Nutritional Considerations: High-calorie diet, high-fat diet, adequate protein, pancreatic enzyme replacement, vitamin and mineral supplementatio n
Foods to Emphasize:
Nutrient-dense foods, full-fat dairy, meats, nuts, seeds, avocado, oils, supplements as prescribed
(fat-soluble vitamins, enzymes)
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Low-fat foods (generally, due to malabsorption), processed foods with limited nutritional value

Nutritional Considerations:
Ketogenic diet (high-fat, very low-carbohydra te) may be used in some cases under supervision
strict medical
Foods to Emphasize:
High-fat foods (oils, butter, heavy cream, avocado), very limited carbohydrates
(non-starchy vegetables in small amounts), adequate
protein
Foods to Limit/Avoid:
High-carbohydr ate foods, sugary foods (in the context of a ketogenic diet),
processed foods (generally for overall health)

Nutritional Considerations: Anti-inflammato ry diet, adequate vitamin D, may benefit from omega-3 fatty acids (not a primary treatment)
Foods to Emphasize: Fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, healthy fats (olive oil, avocado, fatty fish), vitamin D-rich foods or supplements
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Processed foods, saturated and trans fats (potential inflammatory effects), excessive intake of animal fats (some studies suggest a link - more research needed)

Nutritional Considerations: Focus on fiber and fluid intake to manage constipation (common), adequate calorie intake, potential role of antioxidants
Foods to Emphasize: Fruits, vegetables, whole grains, legumes, nuts, seeds, lean proteins, adequate fluid intake
Foods to Limit/Avoid:
Processed foods, excessive saturated fats (some studies suggest a link - more research needed), may need adjustments for protein intake depending on medication timing
(levodopa)

Nutritional Considerations: Maintaining a healthy weight (avoiding both underweight and overweight), nutrient-dense diet, small frequent meals
Foods to Emphasize: Nutrient-dense foods, lean proteins, healthy fats, complex carbohydrates, fruits and vegetables (easy to digest if needed), adequate fluid intake
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Processed foods, excessive simple carbohydrates (can lead to increased carbon dioxide production), large meals (can cause bloating and

breathing
difficulties)

Nutritional Considerations: Sodium restriction, fluid management, adequate protein (with caution in advanced stages), avoiding alcohol
Foods to Emphasize: Low-sodium foods, adequate calorie intake, protein (as tolerated and advised by doctor), easily digestible foods, fruits and vegetables
Foods to Limit/Avoid:
High-sodium foods, excessive fluids, alcohol, raw shellfish (increased risk of infection), potentially high protein in advanced stages (needs careful
management)

Key Symptoms: Severely restricted food intake, fear of weight gain, distorted body image
Nutritional Considerations: Nutritional rehabilitation is a primary focus, gradual increase in calorie intake, restoring weight and nutritional deficiencies
Foods to Emphasize: Nutrient-dense foods across all food groups, balanced macronutrient intake, often requires medical and psychological support
Foods to Limit/Avoid:
Restrictive behaviors are the focus of avoidance; the goal is to
re-introduce a variety of foods and normalize eating patterns under medical and psychological
supervision.

Key Symptoms: Episodes of binge eating followed by compensatory behaviors (vomiting, laxative use, excessive exercise)
Nutritional Considerations: Focus on breaking the binge-purge cycle, establishing regular eating patterns, nutritional rehabilitation
Foods to Emphasize: Balanced and regular meals and snacks, nutrient-dense foods across all food groups, often requires medical and psychological support
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Foods that trigger binge episodes may need to be addressed with psychological support; the goal is to normalize eating patterns and eliminate compensatory behaviors under medical and psychological supervision.

Key Symptoms: Wheezing, shortness of breath, coughing, chest tightness
Nutritional Considerations: Focus on anti-inflammatory foods; ensure adequate Vitamin D intake
Foods to Emphasize: Fruits and vegetables (rich in antioxidants), oily fish (omega-3 fatty acids), whole grains
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Processed foods, artificial additives, known allergens (individual triggers vary)

Nutritional Considerations: Increase iron intake, ensure adequate vitamin B12 and folate levels
Foods to Emphasize: Red meat, leafy green vegetables, beans, lentils, fortified cereals, nuts, seeds
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Foods that inhibit iron absorption (excessive tea, coffee, calcium-rich foods consumed with iron-rich meals)

Nutritional Considerations: Fiber, antioxidants, phytoestrogens
Foods to Emphasize: Soy may help, not hinder – evidence mixed
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Alcohol  High-fat dairy products  Processed meats  Fried and fast foods

Nutritional Considerations: Fiber, calcium, vitamin D
Foods to Emphasize: High-fiber diet reduces recurrence risk
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Red and processed meats Refined grains Excessively salty or pickled foods

Nutritional Considerations: Lycopene, selenium, vitamin E
Foods to Emphasize: Limit calcium to moderate intake
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Dairy products (high-fat) Saturated fats High calcium intake

Nutritional Considerations: Antioxidants, omega-3s
Foods to Emphasize: Smoking cessation is still #1 priority
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Processed meats Fried foods Excess alcohol

Nutritional Considerations: Antioxidants, B vitamins
Foods to Emphasize: Small, frequent meals help digestion
Foods to Limit/Avoid: High-fat diets Sugary drinks Excessive alcohol

Nutritional Considerations: Antioxidants, vitamin C
Foods to Emphasize: Helicobacter pylori control is essential
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Salt-preserved foods Processed meats Alcohol Highly spicy foods

Nutritional Considerations: Antioxidants, vitamin E, selenium
Foods to Emphasize: Manage liver function, low sodium diet
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Alcohol Unhealthy oils Processed and high-sugar foods

Nutritional Considerations: Fiber, flavonoids, vitamin D
Foods to Emphasize: Hydration is important during treatment
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Trans fats Dairy (high-fat) Excess alcohol

Nutritional Considerations: Iron, B12, folate
Foods to Emphasize: Focus on immune-supporting nutrition
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Processed sugars Highly processed foods

Nutritional Considerations: Vitamin C, E, beta-carotene
Foods to Emphasize: Avoid vitamin A megadoses from supplements
Foods to Limit/Avoid: Excess alcohol Processed meats Sugary foods
